intro: Geranium geifolium, commonly known as the pink geranium, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, pink to red flowers. The plant features heart-shaped leaves with a hairy texture, and it thrives in full sun to partial shade. Geranium geifolium is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators. It is relatively low maintenance and prefers well-drained soil.
